content.description: Still Waters is another of the gems on this wall.  Start to the right of Backwaters, with a conspicuous dish, and small gaston pocket above you.  Move up tenuously to a perfect sloper knob. Match that and move up and right to a ragged jug.  Sinker pockets to top out.

Little Fin is just to the right of Big Fin, and though some of their holds are very close, they don't share any.  

  With a really small mono pocket move up to a left hand sidepull pinch. Bust out right to the bottom of the vertical fin feature. Big bump up. Then pinch the nipple hold up and left. Big move up to an incut crimp rail.

Named for the "off route" horn feature on the left hand side of the Giant Hollow Flake...  This problem climbs just to the left of the horn. Starting at a slopey three finger pocket stand up powerfully to the double finger bucket pockets. Move straight up to crimp rail or good sidepull edges.
content.location: Just left of the Giant Hollow Flake

content.description: The classic tall jug haul! Start out with good pockets and find a high right (tan colored) side pull jug.  This allows you to move up and left over the bulge to huge holds.  Move up into weakness and then up and left.
content.location: Just past the down climb and large standing dead tree there is an easy line, and then this one.

content.description:
Big Fin is one of the first lines on the left side of the wall.  Look for a conspicuous right facing vertical fin.   

  Start below the fin and just to the right.  Hit a square cut finger bucket with the left hand and a smaller biter crimp for the right. Dyno on up to the fin.
content.location: Left side of the Cove Wall

content.description: Backwaters is a classic little romp up some big holds on the steepest part of the bulge. Start off of little crimps and move up and left to a breast like pinch hold. Move into the good pockets above and left of this, and left again to a very good, solid jug on the right side of the Giant Hollow Flake. Square up, and toss straight up for a great finger bucket, and then a good right hand hold over the lip.
content.location: Middle of the wall directly right of the Giant Hollow Flake.

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge

content.description:
The Cove Wall is the long wall on the east side of the gully.  This is a classic bulge wall, with tricky starts to dynamic movement over the apex. At the steepest part of the wall there is a Giant Hollow Flake on the apex of the bulge.  From below it is obvious to see where the bounderies of this thing lay, though it feels and looks solid. Tap it with a hammer though and it's weakness is revealed. I left the jug rail that makes up the top of this flake dirty, and did not do any problems directly over this feature. I make mention of it for safety reasons and for further descriptions. 

  Despite that, this wall delivers a fine selection of problems on great rock.  And all of them are deceptively difficult.
